page.title: 17THE METHODIST CHAPEL
page.content: The present{chapel}was built, adjoining the Wesleyan Chapel,in 1882.The land was bought for Â£30 in 1875 and the building officially opened in October 1883. It is described as being 'Romanesque style'. At that time the{population}was great and many people in the dale were methodists. On the afternoon of the opening only 21 of the 217 children on roll attended school. The Chapel stands in a prominent position by the side of the road and has its own graveyard. In 1985 a new minister was appointed to the circuit. His first service in Arkengarthdale took place in September 1985 with a{congregation}of 2 people and an organist. At the moment renovations and the installation of new central heating are taking place.
